front.title: IPv4-mapped IPv6 Instance IDs in IS-IS

abstract.t: This memo defines two new Instance Identifiers (Instance IDs) in IS-IS [RFC1195]). These new Instance IDs [I-D.ietf-isis-mi] are meant to instantiate distinct IS-IS instances to convey routing information which is restricted to IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses [I-D.ietf-behave-address-format]. The ultimate goal of running separate instances for IPv4-mapped IPv6 is to isolate the native IPv6 routing table from the IPv4 and to prevent to be overloaded by IPv4- mapped one. This isolation is motivated also from an operational perspective to allow specific engineering policies for each instance.
